verb.description: Remove from office suddenly and forcefully.
examples: he had been deposed by a military coup

verb.description: Testify to or give (evidence) on oath, typically in a written statement.
examples: every affidavit shall state which of the facts deposed to are within the deponent's knowledge

origin: Middle English: from Old French deposer, from Latin deponere (see deponent), but influenced by Latin depositus and Old French poser to place.
